info.description: API to create, update and manage various types of Trade Finance Letter of Credit (LC) instruments and their associated status and details. Some of the types of LCs that can be created are Sight payments, Back-to-Back, Standby's and Usance LCs
info.title: Management of Letter of Credits

post.summary: Initiate a new drawing request to check the documents for letter of credit
post.description: Initiate a new drawing request for a specific letter of credit

parameters.name: drawingId
parameters.description: Identifier of drawings application under the Letter of Credit system that is used to effect the transfer of funds and the acceptance of documents under Letters of Credit and Documentary Collection transaction.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Identifies the required operation to be executed for a Trade Finance contract. Input of valid codes as: O for opening of LC, P for Pre-advise of LC, A for Amend LC, C for Collect Charges, D for Decision on Amendments, T for Tracer, IO for LC through Internet Banking Operation and M for Ancillary Message (MT759)

code.description: The code related to override message.

responseCode.description: The user input to accept/reject the override.

chargeAccountIds.description: Indicates the account to which the charges has to be levied. Used when charges are to be taken from a separate account

chargeAccountId.description: Indicates the account to which the charges has to be levied. Used when charges are to be taken from a separate account

messageFromBanks.description: Field to input queries/clarifications by bank to be sought from Corporate customer on the request.

messageFromBank.description: Field to input queries/clarifications by bank to be sought from Corporate customer on the request.

messageFromCustomers.description: Field to input any additional information/clarifications to be provided to the bank, by Corporate customer.

messageFromCustomer.description: Field to input any additional information/clarifications to be provided to the bank, by Corporate customer.

consolidatedDiscrepancy.description: Consolidates the discrepancies that are specified in the fields DISCREPANCY,DEF.DISCREPANCY and the DOC.DISCREPANCY fields. The discrepancies listed in this field will only be relayed in the MT734/MT750 OUTWARD swift message.When an Inward MT734/750 is received in T24 the discrepancies listed in the message are mapped to this field.

discrepancyStatus.description: Specifies the current status of each discrepancies

presentorId.description: This field is used to identify the presentor of the documents if they are not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.Optionally input, identifies the presentor customer.

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

drawingType.description: This field is correlated to the other field payment type and identifies the Draw type under Letter of credit. Whether its a sight LC payment, acceptance, deferred payment or Mixed payment.

currencyId.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

documentAmount.description: This field contains the amount to be drawn under this transaction, expressed in the currency above (DRAW.CURRENCY).

valueDate.description: Indicates the value date on which the underlying accounting entry is to be given value (for interest purposes)

debitAccountId.description: Indicates the debit account number of the payment or transaction.

creditAccountId.description: Credit account identifier of the payment or transaction

creditAmount.description: Amount to be credited in a payment transaction

discrepancyResponse.description: Field to record the Applicant's response to discrepancies in the documents under LC.

eventStatus.description: Specifies the status of the request.Allowed values are - With Bank_With Customer_Approved_Rejected.

presentorCustomerId.description: This field is used to identify the presentor of the documents if they are not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.Optionally input, identifies the presentor customer.

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

beneficiaryCustomerName.description: Specifies the name and address of the beneficiary of the guarantee request.

liabilityCreditAmount.description: This field identifies the total liability amount in respect of each individual issued or confirmed letters of credit. Used as a running total of the remaining credit amount available after all current drawings (if any) have been made under the letter of credit. The amount will be expressed in the currency of the letter of credit (LC.CURRENCY).

adviceExpiryDate.description: Specifies the actual expiry date of Guarantee.

percentageDebitAmount.description: This field specifies the negative tolerance relative to the documentary credit amount as a percentage.

percentageCreditAmount.description: Used to define the percentage to be added to the letter of credit amount (LC.AMOUNT) to calculate the full liability amount or maximum amount that can be drawn.

legacyLcId.description: This field is used to identify the banks former or current l/c number (or reference of the L/C on another computer system).

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

beneficiaryAccountId.description: Unique account identifier of the beneficiary account number.

closingDate.description: Indicates the date that the LC is due to be closed, and written to the history files. If any drawings are outstanding on this date for the LC, then the LC will not be closed.

tenor.description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections only. It is used in conjunction with the following field 'DAYS' or 'COLL.MAT.CODE' to indicate the TENOR of the drafts under the collection and is used in the production of corresponding Collection messages.

advisingBankCustomerId.description: This field is mandatory for Import Letter of Credits and contains the customer number or mnemonic of the advising bank.

advisingBankAccountId.description: Identifies the account number of the Advising bank to be used as the default payment account.

issuingBankId.description: Identifies the Issuing bank ID under the LC, who issues the LC under when a bank is advising the Letter of Credit

externalReference.description: For Export/Advising Letter of Credit this is the Issuing Bank's/Opener's reference.

payType.description: Indicates the identifier of payment types for  letter of credit.

paymentTypeDetails.description: Indicates the identifier of payment type enrichment for letter of credit.

nextDrawingId.description: This field displays the number of the next drawing that will be made under the letter of credit. 01 is defaulted if there are no drawings against the L/C.

maximumCreditAmount.description: Indicates the maximum amount that can be drawn under this Letter of Credit.

lastestShipmentDate.description: Used for the production of messages/advices, this field stipulates the latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC.

expiryPlace.description: Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

confirmInstruction.description: This field contains confirmation instructions for the Receiver

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: Identifies the Customer who is to be the ultimate receiver of the funds transferred by the sending bank when this Beneficiary is not a bank.

issuingBankNumber.description: This field identifies the Issuing Bank.

days.description: Valid for Documentary Collections and used in conjunction with the field TENOR to indicate the tenor of the drafts under the collection. It is used in the production of corresponding documentary collection messages and to support Option K of Tag 32a of SWIFT MT400, accepts D or M followed by number representing number of Days or number of Months.

dateAccepted.description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections Only. It records the maturity date as advised by the Collecting Bank of a usance draft accepted payable by the Drawee.

applicantAccountId.description: Defines the default account to be used for reimbursement from the Applicant in the case of an Import Letter of Credit and the Drawee in the event of an Inward Collection.

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides

operation.description: Identifies the required operation to be executed for a Trade Finance contract. Input of valid codes as: O for opening of LC, P for Pre-advise of LC, A for Amend LC, C for Collect Charges, D for Decision on Amendments, T for Tracer, IO for LC through Internet Banking Operation and M for Ancillary Message (MT759)

collectionMaturityCode.description: This field indicates the codes available for the drafts under a collection.

applicantCustomerId.description: This field identifies the applicant on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is issued, if the applicant is held on the CUSTOMER file.

incoTerms.description: This field holds the valid incoterms code

transferable.description: This field is used to decide whether LC is tranferrable or not when LC initiated through Internet Banking.

standByLId.description: This field is used to decide whether LC is STANBY or not when LC initiated through Internet Banking.

partialShipmentText.description: This field holds the details of Part Shipment.

transhipmentText.description: Identifies if transhipments are allowed under the terms of the LC.

shipmentDespatch.description: This Multi-value field indicates the place of Dispatch or Taking in charge of the goods or Loading on board.Used for the production of documents and advice, stipulates the place of Dispatch or Taking in charge of the goods or Loading on board for shipments made under the Letter of Credit.

otherDespatchDetails.description: It denotes the Port of Loading/Airport of Departure.populated to 44E tag of 707 message.

transportation.description: Indicates the final destination of the goods.Used for the production of documents and advice stipulated, the final destination of the goods shipped under the Letter of Credit.

finalDestination.description: Indicates the final destination or place of delivery of the shipment under the LC.

availableByDescription.description: This field identifies the how the credit is available under Letter of Credit.

shipmentMode.description: This field is used to define the mode of shipment used to transport goods.

provision.description: This field turns on the Provision processing for import Letters of Credit and export confirmed LCs.. When this field is set to 'YES' , an account/percentage provision can be entered. The system will then calculate (using the percentage entered) a provision amount, which will be passed to the Provision.amount field. This amount is in the currency of the provision account.

chargesFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

percentageDebitAmount.description: This field specifies the negative tolerance relative to the documentary credit amount as a percentage.

maximumCreditAmount.description: Indicates the maximum amount that can be drawn under this Letter of Credit.

payTerms.description: This field is used to decide the pay type for LC when LC initiated through Internet Banking.

tenor.description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections only. It is used in conjunction with the following field 'DAYS' or 'COLL.MAT.CODE' to indicate the TENOR of the drafts under the collection and is used in the production of corresponding Collection messages.

incoTerms.description: This field holds the valid incoterms code

transferable.description: This field is used to decide whether LC is tranferrable or not when LC initiated through Internet Banking.

confirmInstructions.description: This field contains confirmation instructions for the Receiver.

standByLC.description: This field is used to decide whether LC is STANBY or not when LC initiated through Internet Banking.

limitBroken.description: Specifes that when a CRITICAL limit override message is received. Additional information may be added here for the Credit Officer of the account .

partialShipmentText.description: This field holds the details of Part Shipment.

transhipments.description: Identifies if transhipments are allowed under the terms of the LC. Valid codes are ALLOWED, CONDITIONAL, and NOT ALLOWED.

shipmentDespatch.description: This Multi-value field indicates the place of Dispatch or Taking in charge of the goods or Loading on board.Used for the production of documents and advice, stipulates the place of Dispatch or Taking in charge of the goods or Loading on board for shipments made under the Letter of Credit.

otherDespatchDetails.description: It denotes the Port of Loading/Airport of Departure.populated to 44E tag of 707 message.

transportation.description: Indicates the final destination of the goods.Used for the production of documents and advice stipulated, the final destination of the goods shipped under the Letter of Credit.

finalDestination.description: Indicates the final destination or place of delivery of the shipment under the LC.

latestShipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC.

availableBy.description: This field identifies the how the credit is available under Letter of Credit.

lcType.description: Indicates the type of LC, whether this is an Import/Export, Confirmed/Unconfirmed/Revolving/Transferrable/Back to Back LC/documentary collection/Clean collection etc.

shipmentMode.description: This field is used to define the mode of shipment used to transport goods.

applicantAccountId.description: Defines the default account to be used for reimbursement from the Applicant in the case of an Import Letter of Credit and the Drawee in the event of an Inward Collection.

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

days.description: Valid for Documentary Collections and used in conjunction with the field TENOR to indicate the tenor of the drafts under the collection. It is used in the production of corresponding documentary collection messages and to support Option K of Tag 32a of SWIFT MT400, accepts D or M followed by number representing number of Days or number of Months.

collectionMaturityCode.description: This field indicates the codes available for the drafts under a collection.

dateAccepted.description: This field is valid for Documentary Collections Only. It records the maturity date as advised by the Collecting Bank of a usance draft accepted payable by the Drawee.

beneficiaryAccountId.description: Unique account identifier of the beneficiary account number.

operation.description: Identifies the required operation to be executed for a Trade Finance contract. Input of valid codes as: O for opening of LC, P for Pre-advise of LC, A for Amend LC, C for Collect Charges, D for Decision on Amendments, T for Tracer, IO for LC through Internet Banking Operation and M for Ancillary Message (MT759)

provision.description: This field turns on the Provision processing for import Letters of Credit and export confirmed LCs.. When this field is set to 'YES' , an account/percentage provision can be entered. The system will then calculate (using the percentage entered) a provision amount, which will be passed to the Provision.amount field. This amount is in the currency of the provision account.

chargesFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: Identifies the Customer who is to be the ultimate receiver of the funds transferred by the sending bank when this Beneficiary is not a bank.

recordStatus.description: General status of the record. Possible values: - null - authorised - IHLD - input, on hold - INAU - input, not authorised - INA2 - input, authorised, pending second authorisation - INAO - input, not authorised with blocking overrides - RNAU - reversed, not authorised - RNAO - reversed, not authorised with blocking overrides

externalReference.description: For Export/Advising Letter of Credit this is the Issuing Bank's/Opener's reference.

chargesAccountId.description: This field identifies the account from which related charges will be taken, if any.Any valid account number can be entered in this field.

commissionAccountId.description: This is the account for paying the commission at the Schedule date.

provisionAccountId.description: This field is used to determine the account from which the provision should be debited when such a transaction is deemed to require provision.

provisionAmount.description: This field is used to register any changes in the amount of provision held.

documentId.description: Based on documentCode, the field defaults the required document codes

ibStatus.description: Field to indicate the status of LC request through internet banking.

advisingBankCustomerId.description: This field is mandatory for Import Letter of Credits and contains the customer number or mnemonic of the advising bank.

issuingBankId.description: Identifies the Issuing bank ID under the LC, who issues the LC under when a bank is advising the Letter of Credit

closingDate.description: Indicates the date that the LC is due to be closed, and written to the history files. If any drawings are outstanding on this date for the LC, then the LC will not be closed.

availableWithCustomerId.description: Used for the production of letter of credit messages/advices, this field identifies the bank authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate documents presented under the L/C if it is not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.

documentsReceived.description: Indicates that when an outward collection is initiated through internet banking, this field specifies if original documents have been received by the bank.

applicantCustomerName.description: This field identifies the applicant on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is issued, if the applicant is held on the CUSTOMER file.

advisingBanks.description: Identifies the advising bank under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

advisingBank.description: Identifies the advising bank under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

beneficiaryCustomerName.description: Specifies the name and address of the beneficiary of the guarantee request.

availableWith.description: Used for the production of letter of credit messages/advices, this field identifies the bank authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate documents presented under the L/C if it is not a customer of the bank with a valid CUSTOMER.NO.

additionalAmountsCovered.description: Specifies any additional amounts available under the Letter of Credit, such as insurance, freight, interest, etc.

additionalAmountCovered.description: Specifies any additional amounts available under the Letter of Credit, such as insurance, freight, interest, etc.

deferredPayment.description: This free text field will specify the payment date or method for its determination for which deferred payment or a Negotiation drawings will be made under the LC.

contactInformation.description: Free text field to hold telephone numbers or email address for applicant bankers to contact when LC initiated through Internet Banking.

shipmentPeriods.description: Indicates the period of time which the goods are to be loaded on board/dispatched/taken in charge.

shipmentPeriod.description: Indicates the period of time which the goods are to be loaded on board/dispatched/taken in charge.

presentationPeriod.description: Used for the production of messages/advices this field specifies the number of days after the date of issuance of the transports document(s) within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation.

descriptionOfGood.description: Indicate the details of the amendment to the description of the goods under a Letter of Credit contract. The text to begin with the valid codes: ADD or DELETE or REPALL

documentCode.description: Required documents under a Letter of Credit

document1stCopy.description: Used in the production of messages/advices, this field in conjunction with <DOCUMENT.CODE> is used to identify the number of each document being sent in the first mailing to the respective party.

documentText.description: Specifies the description of document code

documentsRequired.description: Free textfield used to describe the documents to be presented under the letter of credit, in addition to the predefined documents associated with documentCode.

documentRequired.description: Free textfield used to describe the documents to be presented under the letter of credit, in addition to the predefined documents associated with documentCode.

clausesText.description: Contains the full clause text which is used in the construction of L/C Advices/Documents generated as a result of L/C transactions.

additionalConditions.description: Amendment details to the additional conditions under a LC contract. Must begin with the valid codes: ADD or DELETE or REPALL.

additionalCondition.description: Amendment details to the additional conditions under a LC contract. Must begin with the valid codes: ADD or DELETE or REPALL.

narrativeCharges.description: Field to specify the details of the charges to be borne by the beneficiary

narrativeCharge.description: Field to specify the details of the charges to be borne by the beneficiary

fromCustomerMessage.description: his field indicates that message from the customer

issuingBank.description: This field identifies the Issuing Bank for an Export Letter of Credit and the Collecting Bank for an Outward Documentary Collection.

documentName.description: The accepted forms of identification taken by the bank when enrolling a Customer

instruction.description: Contains the instruction control for the current service. Allowed values: - START: to start the current service. - STOP: to stop the current service - AUTO: to start the current service automatically and stop at the end of the process.

ibReason.description: This field holds the reason for change in IB.STATUS field.

overrides.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

override.description: The override message is captured  that was generated at the time of commitment of the transaction to the database.

advisingBankAddress.description: Identifies the name and address of the advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit to be advised to second advising bank or beneficiary.

adviseThroughBanks.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

adviseThroughBank.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

availableWithBanks.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

availableWithBank.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

reimbursingBanks1.description: Identifies the Name & Address of the reimbursing bank under the LC. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer list), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank.

reimbursingBank1.description: Identifies the Name & Address of the reimbursing bank under the LC. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer list), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank.

requestedConfirmBankNames.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

requestedConfirmBankName.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

charges.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

chargeCode.description: Indicates the charge code to which the charges are identified and calculated and to be debited to the customer account. For example: C(Credit less Charges The Credit less Charges), D(Debit plus Charge The Debit plus Charge) , W(Waive).

partyCharged.description: Code to determine the identity of the party from whom the related charge is to be taken. Allowed values: -B(eneficiary) - O(pener) - T(hird Party).

chargeDebitAccount.description: The account number of the account where charges will be debited to.

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

ChargeExchangeRate.description: Indicates the exchange rate to be used between the charge debit account and the charge currency is different.

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

amortiseCharges.description: Define if charges are to be amortised over the life of the LC. Y or N  input

chargeStatus.description: Indicates the codes to identify the different status of the charge. If the charge has been taken, claimed, or to be deferred or waived. The codes that are used to identify various states of the charge are: null, 2, 3, 4, 5, 15.

taxCurrency.description: Contains the currency that tax is to be levied in. Example USD, GBP etc.

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

importSightPmtLcType.description: Identifies the Import Sight Payment type of LC

lcNumber.description: Identifies the Advising banks LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system) or it can be used for the bank to use a unique Letter of Credit number rather than the system generated ID

applicant.description: Indicates the applicant name and address on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is being pre advised.

lcCurrency.description: Denote the currency of the Letter of Credit.

lcAmount.description: This field indicates the amount of the Letter of Credit that will always be expressed in the currency of Letter of Credit.

creditTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit the amount can be specified plus or minus a tolerance expressed as a percentage which will always impact the LC liability for the greater amount including the plus tolerance as defined in this field.

debitTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit, the amount can be specified with a tolerance, which will impact the LC liability for the greater amount. The amount in this field specifies a negative tolerance expressed as a percentage of the LC amount. It can impact the final drawing amount but not the live LC amount.

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

expiryPlace.description: Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

daysAndPeriodForPresentation.description: Specifies the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation.

shipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

liabilityReversalDate.description: Date on which the contingent entries and the limits raised on the LC will be reversed.

incoTerms.description: This field holds the valid incoterms code

modeOfShipment.description: Defining the mode of shipment allowed for transporting the goods and service under the LC. Allowed values are: - Air - Sea - Road - Rail - Multi Modal - Other

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

autoExpiry.description: Decision field to determine whether the contingent entries are to be reversed after the deal expiry date or not Allowed values: - YES - NO - null (default value, same as NO)

applicableRuleCodesMT740.description: Indicates the reimbursement rules that the Letter of Credit contract is subject to. Allowed values: - URR LATEST VERSION - NOTURR - null (default)

confirmationInstruction.description: This field contains confirmation instructions for the receiver of the SWIFT MT700 / MT710

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: Identifies the Customer who is to be the ultimate receiver of the funds transferred by the sending bank when this Beneficiary is not a bank.

advisingBankId.description: Identifies the advising bank ID under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

adviseThroughBank.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

availableWithBankId.description: Indicates the bank ID that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

reimbursingBank.description: Identifies the reimbursing bank ID under the LC, through whom reimbursement will be made to the paying/negotiating bank for a letter of credit. (Reimbursing bank should be a valid customer with customer ID)

requestedConfirmBank.description: Id of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

chargeFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

chargeDefaultAccount.description: This field identifies the default charge account under which all present and future charges under the letter of credit will be debited to. This eliminates the need to specify the charge account for every charge

waiveCharge.description: Indicates if the charges are to be waived for the instruction

marginRequired.description: Decision field enabling a cash margin to be blocked for the LC contract. Yes or No, default is No

releaseProvision.description: Flag to enable the online release of the cash margin. Allowed values: - YES - null (default)

marginCalculationBase.description: This field determines if the margin to be calculated based on the LC base amount or the total liability amount including tolerance etc.

marginPercent.description: Field to state the percentage of provision to be taken

marginDebitAccount.description: Field to state the account from which the provision amount is to be debited

marginAmount.description: Actual amount of provision that is debited for the transaction

marginExchangeRate.description: This Field determines the exchange rate to be used between the provision debit account and the provision credit account, when the currencies differ

limitWithProvision.description: This field determines if the margin calculated to be debited after considering the limits booked under the LC contract. Yes or No

documentId.description: Based on documentCode, the field defaults the required document codes

documentCode.description: Required documents under a Letter of Credit

documentsText.description: Free text field to amend or generate additional documentation

documentRequired.description: Free textfield used to describe the documents to be presented under the letter of credit, in addition to the predefined documents associated with documentCode.

additionalCondition.description: Amendment details to the additional conditions under a LC contract. Must begin with the valid codes: ADD or DELETE or REPALL.

applicantAddresses.description: Indicates the name and address of the applicant of the Letter of Credit

applicantAddress.description: Indicates the name and address of the applicant of the Letter of Credit

beneficiaryAddresses.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

beneficiaryAddress.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

advisingBankAddresses.description: Identifies the name and address of the advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit to be advised to second advising bank or beneficiary.

advisingBankAddress.description: Identifies the name and address of the advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit to be advised to second advising bank or beneficiary.

adviseThroughBanks.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

adviseThroughBank.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

availableWithBanks.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

availableWithBank.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

reimbursingBanks1.description: Identifies the Name & Address of the reimbursing bank under the LC. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer list), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank.

reimbursingBank1.description: Identifies the Name & Address of the reimbursing bank under the LC. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer list), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank.

requestedConfirmBankNames.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

requestedConfirmBankName.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

charges.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

chargeCode.description: Indicates the charge code to which the charges are identified and calculated and to be debited to the customer account. For example: C(Credit less Charges The Credit less Charges), D(Debit plus Charge The Debit plus Charge) , W(Waive).

partyCharged.description: Code to determine the identity of the party from whom the related charge is to be taken. Allowed values: -B(eneficiary) - O(pener) - T(hird Party).

chargeDebitAccount.description: The account number of the account where charges will be debited to.

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

ChargeExchangeRate.description: Indicates the exchange rate to be used between the charge debit account and the charge currency is different.

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

amortiseCharges.description: Define if charges are to be amortised over the life of the LC. Y or N  input

chargeStatus.description: Indicates the codes to identify the different status of the charge. If the charge has been taken, claimed, or to be deferred or waived. The codes that are used to identify various states of the charge are: null, 2, 3, 4, 5, 15.

taxCurrency.description: Contains the currency that tax is to be levied in. Example USD, GBP etc.

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

importSightPmtLcType.description: Identifies the Import Sight Payment type of LC

applicantAddress.description: Indicates the name and address of the applicant of the Letter of Credit

beneficiaryAddresses.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

beneficiaryAddress.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

advisingBankAddresses.description: Identifies the name and address of the advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit to be advised to second advising bank or beneficiary.

advisingBankAddress.description: Identifies the name and address of the advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit to be advised to second advising bank or beneficiary.

adviseThroughBanks.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

adviseThroughBank.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

availableWithBanks.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

availableWithBank.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

reimbursingBanks1.description: Identifies the Name & Address of the reimbursing bank under the LC. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer list), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank.

reimbursingBank1.description: Identifies the Name & Address of the reimbursing bank under the LC. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer list), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank.

requestedConfirmBankNames.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

requestedConfirmBankName.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

charges.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

chargeCode.description: Indicates the charge code to which the charges are identified and calculated and to be debited to the customer account. For example: C(Credit less Charges The Credit less Charges), D(Debit plus Charge The Debit plus Charge) , W(Waive).

partyCharged.description: Code to determine the identity of the party from whom the related charge is to be taken. Allowed values: -B(eneficiary) - O(pener) - T(hird Party).

chargeDebitAccount.description: The account number of the account where charges will be debited to.

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

ChargeExchangeRate.description: Indicates the exchange rate to be used between the charge debit account and the charge currency is different.

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

amortiseCharges.description: Define if charges are to be amortised over the life of the LC. Y or N  input

chargeStatus.description: Indicates the codes to identify the different status of the charge. If the charge has been taken, claimed, or to be deferred or waived. The codes that are used to identify various states of the charge are: null, 2, 3, 4, 5, 15.

taxCurrency.description: Contains the currency that tax is to be levied in. Example USD, GBP etc.

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

importNegotiationLCType.description: Identifies the Import Negotiation type of LC

lcNumber.description: Identifies the Advising banks LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system) or it can be used for the bank to use a unique Letter of Credit number rather than the system generated ID

applicant.description: Indicates the applicant name and address on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is being pre advised.

lcCurrency.description: Denote the currency of the Letter of Credit.

lcAmount.description: This field indicates the amount of the Letter of Credit that will always be expressed in the currency of Letter of Credit.

creditTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit the amount can be specified plus or minus a tolerance expressed as a percentage which will always impact the LC liability for the greater amount including the plus tolerance as defined in this field.

debitTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit, the amount can be specified with a tolerance, which will impact the LC liability for the greater amount. The amount in this field specifies a negative tolerance expressed as a percentage of the LC amount. It can impact the final drawing amount but not the live LC amount.

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

expiryPlace.description: Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

liabilityReversalDate.description: Date on which the contingent entries and the limits raised on the LC will be reversed.

daysAndPeriodForPresentation.description: Specifies the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation.

shipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC

incoTerms.description: This field holds the valid incoterms code

modeOfShipment.description: Defining the mode of shipment allowed for transporting the goods and service under the LC. Allowed values are: - Air - Sea - Road - Rail - Multi Modal - Other

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

autoExpiry.description: Decision field to determine whether the contingent entries are to be reversed after the deal expiry date or not Allowed values: - YES - NO - null (default value, same as NO)

collMatCode.description: In support of Option K of Tag 32a in MT400 series of SWIFT for collections, this field supports the applicable codes.

days.description: Valid for Documentary Collections and used in conjunction with the field TENOR to indicate the tenor of the drafts under the collection. It is used in the production of corresponding documentary collection messages and to support Option K of Tag 32a of SWIFT MT400, accepts D or M followed by number representing number of Days or number of Months.

applicableRuleCodesMT740.description: Indicates the reimbursement rules that the Letter of Credit contract is subject to. Allowed values: - URR LATEST VERSION - NOTURR - null (default)

confirmationInstruction.description: This field contains confirmation instructions for the receiver of the SWIFT MT700 / MT710

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: Identifies the Customer who is to be the ultimate receiver of the funds transferred by the sending bank when this Beneficiary is not a bank.

advisingBankId.description: Identifies the advising bank ID under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

adviseThroughBank.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

availableWithBankId.description: Indicates the bank ID that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

reimbursingBank.description: Identifies the reimbursing bank ID under the LC, through whom reimbursement will be made to the paying/negotiating bank for a letter of credit. (Reimbursing bank should be a valid customer with customer ID)

requestedConfirmBank.description: Id of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

chargeFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

chargeDefaultAccount.description: This field identifies the default charge account under which all present and future charges under the letter of credit will be debited to. This eliminates the need to specify the charge account for every charge

waiveCharge.description: Indicates if the charges are to be waived for the instruction

marginRequired.description: Decision field enabling a cash margin to be blocked for the LC contract. Yes or No, default is No

releaseProvision.description: Flag to enable the online release of the cash margin. Allowed values: - YES - null (default)

marginCalculationBase.description: This field determines if the margin to be calculated based on the LC base amount or the total liability amount including tolerance etc.

marginPercent.description: Field to state the percentage of provision to be taken

marginDebitAccount.description: Field to state the account from which the provision amount is to be debited

marginAmount.description: Actual amount of provision that is debited for the transaction

marginExchangeRate.description: This Field determines the exchange rate to be used between the provision debit account and the provision credit account, when the currencies differ

limitWithProvision.description: This field determines if the margin calculated to be debited after considering the limits booked under the LC contract. Yes or No

documentId.description: Based on documentCode, the field defaults the required document codes

documentCode.description: Required documents under a Letter of Credit

documentsText.description: Free text field to amend or generate additional documentation

drawingType.description: This field is correlated to the other field payment type and identifies the Draw type under Letter of credit. Whether its a sight LC payment, acceptance, deferred payment or Mixed payment.

paymentPercent.description: This field identifies the percentage amount of LC that is available for a particular draw type.

paymentPortion.description: Identifies the amount of LC that is available for a particular draw type.

acptTimeBand.description: This field indicate the number of days applicable to an Acceptance or Deferred Payment period under a letter of credit.

additionalCoveredAmount.description: This field allows input of an amount that will be added to the liability amount of the LC and the limit will be updated accordingly.

portionNo.description: This is a system generated field to display the revolution number under a revolving letter of credit.

drawingAmount.description: System populated field that holds the amount of drawing processed under the related draw type multi value set.

provisionOutstandingAmount.description: This is a system populated field to display the provision / margin outstanding amount.

provisionAwaitAmount.description: This is a system populated field to display the related provision amount to be released subsequently on maturity date of a related drawing.

liabilityPortionAmount.description: This is a system populated field to display the liability relating to each portion (MX or revolving type of LC) such as sight, acceptance or deferred payment is stored here.

localCurrencyPortiomAmount.description: This is a system populated field to display the local currency equivalent of the liability portion stored in liability portion amount.

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

portionOverdrawn.description: This is a system populated field to display the amount overdrawn for a particular portion in a mixed payment transaction.

importMixedPmtLCType.description: Identifies the Import Mixed payment type of LC

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

ChargeExchangeRate.description: Indicates the exchange rate to be used between the charge debit account and the charge currency is different.

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

amortiseCharges.description: Define if charges are to be amortised over the life of the LC. Y or N  input

chargeStatus.description: Indicates the codes to identify the different status of the charge. If the charge has been taken, claimed, or to be deferred or waived. The codes that are used to identify various states of the charge are: null, 2, 3, 4, 5, 15.

taxCurrency.description: Contains the currency that tax is to be levied in. Example USD, GBP etc.

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

drawingType.description: This field is correlated to the other field payment type and identifies the Draw type under Letter of credit. Whether its a sight LC payment, acceptance, deferred payment or Mixed payment.

paymentPercent.description: This field identifies the percentage amount of LC that is available for a particular draw type.

paymentPortion.description: Identifies the amount of LC that is available for a particular draw type.

acptTimeBand.description: This field indicate the number of days applicable to an Acceptance or Deferred Payment period under a letter of credit.

additionalCoveredAmount.description: This field allows input of an amount that will be added to the liability amount of the LC and the limit will be updated accordingly.

portionNo.description: This is a system generated field to display the revolution number under a revolving letter of credit.

drawingAmount.description: System populated field that holds the amount of drawing processed under the related draw type multi value set.

provisionOutstandingAmount.description: This is a system populated field to display the provision / margin outstanding amount.

provisionAwaitAmount.description: This is a system populated field to display the related provision amount to be released subsequently on maturity date of a related drawing.

liabilityPortionAmount.description: This is a system populated field to display the liability relating to each portion (MX or revolving type of LC) such as sight, acceptance or deferred payment is stored here.

localCurrencyPortiomAmount.description: This is a system populated field to display the local currency equivalent of the liability portion stored in liability portion amount.

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

portionOverdrawn.description: This is a system populated field to display the amount overdrawn for a particular portion in a mixed payment transaction.

importMixedPmtLCType.description: Identifies the Import Mixed payment type of LC

lcNumber.description: Identifies the Advising banks LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system) or it can be used for the bank to use a unique Letter of Credit number rather than the system generated ID

applicantCustomer.description: Indicates the applicant ID on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is issued.

lcCurrency.description: Denote the currency of the Letter of Credit.

lcAmount.description: This field indicates the amount of the Letter of Credit that will always be expressed in the currency of Letter of Credit.

creditTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit the amount can be specified plus or minus a tolerance expressed as a percentage which will always impact the LC liability for the greater amount including the plus tolerance as defined in this field.

debitTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit, the amount can be specified with a tolerance, which will impact the LC liability for the greater amount. The amount in this field specifies a negative tolerance expressed as a percentage of the LC amount. It can impact the final drawing amount but not the live LC amount.

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

expiryPlace.description: Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

liabilityReversalDate.description: Date on which the contingent entries and the limits raised on the LC will be reversed.

daysAndPeriodForPresentation.description: Specifies the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation.

shipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC

modeOfShipment.description: Defining the mode of shipment allowed for transporting the goods and service under the LC. Allowed values are: - Air - Sea - Road - Rail - Multi Modal - Other

incoTerms.description: This field holds the valid incoterms code

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

autoExpiry.description: Decision field to determine whether the contingent entries are to be reversed after the deal expiry date or not Allowed values: - YES - NO - null (default value, same as NO)

applicableRuleCodesMT740.description: Indicates the reimbursement rules that the Letter of Credit contract is subject to. Allowed values: - URR LATEST VERSION - NOTURR - null (default)

confirmationInstruction.description: This field contains confirmation instructions for the receiver of the SWIFT MT700 / MT710

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: Identifies the Customer who is to be the ultimate receiver of the funds transferred by the sending bank when this Beneficiary is not a bank.

advisingBankId.description: Identifies the advising bank ID under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

adviseThroughBank.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

availableWithBankId.description: Indicates the bank ID that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

reimbursingBank.description: Identifies the reimbursing bank ID under the LC, through whom reimbursement will be made to the paying/negotiating bank for a letter of credit. (Reimbursing bank should be a valid customer with customer ID)

requestedConfirmBank.description: Id of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

chargeFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

chargeDefaultAccount.description: This field identifies the default charge account under which all present and future charges under the letter of credit will be debited to. This eliminates the need to specify the charge account for every charge

waiveCharge.description: Indicates if the charges are to be waived for the instruction

marginRequired.description: Decision field enabling a cash margin to be blocked for the LC contract. Yes or No, default is No

releaseProvision.description: Flag to enable the online release of the cash margin. Allowed values: - YES - null (default)

marginCalculationBase.description: This field determines if the margin to be calculated based on the LC base amount or the total liability amount including tolerance etc.

marginPercent.description: Field to state the percentage of provision to be taken

marginDebitAccount.description: Field to state the account from which the provision amount is to be debited

marginAmount.description: Actual amount of provision that is debited for the transaction

marginExchangeRate.description: This Field determines the exchange rate to be used between the provision debit account and the provision credit account, when the currencies differ

limitWithProvision.description: This field determines if the margin calculated to be debited after considering the limits booked under the LC contract. Yes or No

documentId.description: Based on documentCode, the field defaults the required document codes

documentCode.description: Required documents under a Letter of Credit

documentsText.description: Free text field to amend or generate additional documentation

documentRequired.description: Free textfield used to describe the documents to be presented under the letter of credit, in addition to the predefined documents associated with documentCode.

additionalCondition.description: Amendment details to the additional conditions under a LC contract. Must begin with the valid codes: ADD or DELETE or REPALL.

revolvingType.description: Identifies the type of Revolving Letter of Credit , if Cumulative (CM) or Non-Cumulative type. (NC)

numberOfRevolution.description: Identifies the number of times the letter of credit will revolve.

revolvingFrequency.description: Defines the frequency at which the letter of credit is to revolve.

limitForRevolving.description: This field determines if the limit to be impacted to the current LC cycle or for the entire cycle including all the revolving values. Valid input in this field is SINGLE, and Input allowed only if the LC is revolving and non-cumulative in nature.

curRevolLiab.description: Related to revolving Letters of Credit, this is a system populated field to display the liability in terms of the LC currency for the Current revolution.

applicantAddresses.description: Indicates the name and address of the applicant of the Letter of Credit

applicantAddress.description: Indicates the name and address of the applicant of the Letter of Credit

limitReferences.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

beneficiaryAddress.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

advisingBankAddress.description: Identifies the name and address of the advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit to be advised to second advising bank or beneficiary.

beneficiaryCustomerId.description: Identifies the Customer who is to be the ultimate receiver of the funds transferred by the sending bank when this Beneficiary is not a bank.

advisingBankId.description: Identifies the advising bank ID under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

adviseThroughBank.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

availableWithBankId.description: Indicates the bank ID that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

reimbursingBank.description: Identifies the reimbursing bank ID under the LC, through whom reimbursement will be made to the paying/negotiating bank for a letter of credit. (Reimbursing bank should be a valid customer with customer ID)

requestedConfirmBank.description: Id of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

chargeFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

chargeDefaultAccount.description: This field identifies the default charge account under which all present and future charges under the letter of credit will be debited to. This eliminates the need to specify the charge account for every charge

waiveCharge.description: Indicates if the charges are to be waived for the instruction

marginRequired.description: Decision field enabling a cash margin to be blocked for the LC contract. Yes or No, default is No

releaseProvision.description: Flag to enable the online release of the cash margin. Allowed values: - YES - null (default)

marginCalculationBase.description: This field determines if the margin to be calculated based on the LC base amount or the total liability amount including tolerance etc.

marginPercent.description: Field to state the percentage of provision to be taken

marginDebitAccount.description: Field to state the account from which the provision amount is to be debited

marginAmount.description: Actual amount of provision that is debited for the transaction

marginExchangeRate.description: This Field determines the exchange rate to be used between the provision debit account and the provision credit account, when the currencies differ

limitWithProvision.description: This field determines if the margin calculated to be debited after considering the limits booked under the LC contract. Yes or No

applicantAddresses.description: Indicates the name and address of the applicant of the Letter of Credit

applicantAddress.description: Indicates the name and address of the applicant of the Letter of Credit

limitReferences.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

beneficiaryAddresses.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

beneficiaryAddress.description: The address of the Beneficiary if the customer number of the Beneficiary is not known

advisingBankAddresses.description: Identifies the name and address of the advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit to be advised to second advising bank or beneficiary.

advisingBankAddress.description: Identifies the name and address of the advising bank under the LC, through whom Letter of Credit to be advised to second advising bank or beneficiary.

adviseThroughBanks.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

adviseThroughBank.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

availableWithBanks.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

availableWithBank.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

reimbursingBanks1.description: Identifies the Name & Address of the reimbursing bank under the LC. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer list), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank.

reimbursingBank1.description: Identifies the Name & Address of the reimbursing bank under the LC. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer list), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank.

requestedConfirmBankNames.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

requestedConfirmBankName.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

charges.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

chargeCode.description: Indicates the charge code to which the charges are identified and calculated and to be debited to the customer account. For example: C(Credit less Charges The Credit less Charges), D(Debit plus Charge The Debit plus Charge) , W(Waive).

partyCharged.description: Code to determine the identity of the party from whom the related charge is to be taken. Allowed values: -B(eneficiary) - O(pener) - T(hird Party).

chargeDebitAccount.description: The account number of the account where charges will be debited to.

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

ChargeExchangeRate.description: Indicates the exchange rate to be used between the charge debit account and the charge currency is different.

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

amortiseCharges.description: Define if charges are to be amortised over the life of the LC. Y or N  input

chargeStatus.description: Indicates the codes to identify the different status of the charge. If the charge has been taken, claimed, or to be deferred or waived. The codes that are used to identify various states of the charge are: null, 2, 3, 4, 5, 15.

taxCurrency.description: Contains the currency that tax is to be levied in. Example USD, GBP etc.

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

lcNumber.description: Identifies the Advising banks LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system) or it can be used for the bank to use a unique Letter of Credit number rather than the system generated ID

lcType.description: Indicates the type of LC, whether this is an Import/Export, Confirmed/Unconfirmed/Revolving/Transferrable/Back to Back LC/documentary collection/Clean collection etc.

applicant.description: Indicates the applicant name and address on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is being pre advised.

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

creditTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit the amount can be specified plus or minus a tolerance expressed as a percentage which will always impact the LC liability for the greater amount including the plus tolerance as defined in this field.

debitTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit, the amount can be specified with a tolerance, which will impact the LC liability for the greater amount. The amount in this field specifies a negative tolerance expressed as a percentage of the LC amount. It can impact the final drawing amount but not the live LC amount.

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

expiryPlace.description: Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

liabilityReversalDate.description: Date on which the contingent entries and the limits raised on the LC will be reversed.

daysAndPeriodForPresentation.description: Specifies the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation.

shipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC

modeOfShipment.description: Defining the mode of shipment allowed for transporting the goods and service under the LC. Allowed values are: - Air - Sea - Road - Rail - Multi Modal - Other

incoTerms.description: This field holds the valid incoterms code

updateLimit.description: Flag to define if the limits are to be booked or not at the time of issuing the pre-advice LC. Allowed values: - YES - NO (same as null) - null (default).
