draftsAt.description: Indicates the tenor of the draft to be presented under the Letter of Credit.

draftAt.description: Indicates the tenor of the draft to be presented under the Letter of Credit.

drawees.description: Identify the drawee of Bills of Exchange to be presented under the LC, if the drawee is not a customer of the bank with a valid customer number. Drawees Name and Address may be manually input.

drawee.description: Identify the drawee of Bills of Exchange to be presented under the LC, if the drawee is not a customer of the bank with a valid customer number. Drawees Name and Address may be manually input.

mixedPaymentDetails.description: This field specify the payment dates, amounts and/or method for the determination in an LC, which is available by mixed payment.

mixedPaymentDetail.description: This field specify the payment dates, amounts and/or method for the determination in an LC, which is available by mixed payment.

negotiationDeferredPaymentDetails.description: This field specify the payment date or method for its determination for which deferred payment or a Negotiation drawings will be made under the LC

negotiationDeferredPaymentDetail.description: This field specify the payment date or method for its determination for which deferred payment or a Negotiation drawings will be made under the LC

shipmentPeriods.description: Indicates the period of time which the goods are to be loaded on board/dispatched/taken in charge.

shipmentPeriod.description: Indicates the period of time which the goods are to be loaded on board/dispatched/taken in charge.

documentsRequired.description: Free textfield used to describe the documents to be presented under the letter of credit, in addition to the predefined documents associated with documentCode.

documentRequired.description: Free textfield used to describe the documents to be presented under the letter of credit, in addition to the predefined documents associated with documentCode.

additionalConditions.description: Amendment details to the additional conditions under a LC contract. Must begin with the valid codes: ADD or DELETE or REPALL.

additionalCondition.description: Amendment details to the additional conditions under a LC contract. Must begin with the valid codes: ADD or DELETE or REPALL.

narrativeCharges.description: Field to specify the details of the charges to be borne by the beneficiary

narrativeCharge.description: Field to specify the details of the charges to be borne by the beneficiary

requestedConfirmBankNames.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

requestedConfirmBankName.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

instructionsToTheBanks.description: This field can be used to stiputate any special or additional instructions to the Paying/Accepting/Negotiating Bank.

instructionsToTheBank.description: This field can be used to stiputate any special or additional instructions to the Paying/Accepting/Negotiating Bank.

adviseThroughBanks.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

adviseThroughBank.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

lcType.description: Indicates the type of LC, whether this is an Import/Export, Confirmed/Unconfirmed/Revolving/Transferrable/Back to Back LC/documentary collection/Clean collection etc.

parentLCReference.description: Indicates the parent LC number under the transfer LC.

lcTransferAdvisingReference.description: Identifies the Advising banks LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system) at the time of transferring a letter of credit. It can also be used for the bank to use a unique Letter of Credit number rather than the system generated ID

issuingBankLCReference.description: Indicates the Issuing Bank's reference of the Letter of Credit.

issuingBankId.description: Identifies the Issuing bank ID under the LC, who issues the LC under when a bank is advising the Letter of Credit

advisingBank.description: Identifies the advising bank under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

issuingBankName.description: Identifies the Issuing bank name and address of the bank issuing the LC.

lcAdvisingDate.description: Date of advising the Letter of Credit to beneficiary or Second advising bank.

lcCurrency.description: Denote the currency of the Letter of Credit.

lcAmount.description: This field indicates the amount of the Letter of Credit that will always be expressed in the currency of Letter of Credit.

creditTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit the amount can be specified plus or minus a tolerance expressed as a percentage which will always impact the LC liability for the greater amount including the plus tolerance as defined in this field.

debitTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit, the amount can be specified with a tolerance, which will impact the LC liability for the greater amount. The amount in this field specifies a negative tolerance expressed as a percentage of the LC amount. It can impact the final drawing amount but not the live LC amount.

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

expiryPlace.description: Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

liabilityReversalDate.description: Date on which the contingent entries and the limits raised on the LC will be reversed.

autoExpiry.description: Decision field to determine whether the contingent entries are to be reversed after the deal expiry date or not Allowed values: - YES - NO - null (default value, same as NO)

secondBeneficiaryID.description: Indicates the second Beneficiary ID in whose favour the transfer Letter of Credit is transferred

secondBeneficiaryAddress.description: Indicates the second Beneficiary name and address in whose favour the transfer Letter of Credit is transferred.

firstBeneficiaryName.description: Indicates the  First Beneficiary name and address on whose request the transfer Letter of Credit is issued.

availableWithBankID.description: Indicates the bank ID that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

availableWithBank.description: Indicates the bank name and address that is authorised to pay, accept, or negotiate document presented under the letter of credit

adviseThroughBankID.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

adviseThroughBank.description: Identifies the bank ID, if different from the Receiver, through which the Letter of Credit is to be advised/confirmed to the beneficiary.

chargeFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

chargeDefaultAccount.description: This field identifies the default charge account under which all present and future charges under the letter of credit will be debited to. This eliminates the need to specify the charge account for every charge

waiveCharge.description: Indicates if the charges are to be waived for the instruction

confirmationInstruction.description: This field contains confirmation instructions for the receiver of the SWIFT MT700 / MT710

riskParty.description: Identifies the risk party under the LC contract. Must be a valid customer number or Mnemonic. It's a system populated field other than the export LC.

confirmationDate.description: Indicates the Date of adding confirmation to the export LC.

confirmationAmount.description: Value in this field indicates that the portion of the Letter of Credit that has been confirmed.

confirmLiabilityAmount.description: System populated field to indicate the amount in terms of LC currency

unconfirmLiabilityAmount.description: Identifies the total unconfirmed liability amount in respect of partially confirmed Letters of Credit.

unconfirmLimitReference.description: This field indicated the limit reference assigned for the unconfirmed portion of the LC. Input in this field will be allowed based in the parameter system.

revolvingType.description: Identifies the type of Revolving Letter of Credit , if Cumulative (CM) or Non-Cumulative type. (NC)

numberOfRevolution.description: Identifies the number of times the letter of credit will revolve.

revolvingFrequency.description: Defines the frequency at which the letter of credit is to revolve.

limitForRevolving.description: This field determines if the limit to be impacted to the current LC cycle or for the entire cycle including all the revolving values. Valid input in this field is SINGLE, and Input allowed only if the LC is revolving and non-cumulative in nature.

curRevolLiab.description: Related to revolving Letters of Credit, this is a system populated field to display the liability in terms of the LC currency for the Current revolution.

formOfDocCredit.description: This field specifies the type of credit and whether or not the Sender is adding its confirmation to the credit. Valid inputs are: Adding our Confirmation / Without our Confirmation.

transferingBankReference.description: This field  identifies the advising banks transfer LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system).

documentaryCreditNumber.description: Indicates the Issuing Bank's reference of the Documentary Credit.

lcIssueDate.description: This field holds the issue date of Letter of Credit

applicableRule.description: Specifies the rules the Letter of credit is subject to. Following are the valid inputs under this field: UCP LATEST VERSION, EUCP LATEST VERSION, UCPURR LATEST VERSION, EUCPURR LATEST VERSION, ISP LATEST VERSION, OTHR. If OTHR is input then, the rule under which credit is subject to must be input in applicable rules description field.

applicableRuleDescription.description: Specifies the rules the Letter of credit is subject to OTHER condition. If the valid code inputs under the field applicable rules as OTHR, then the rule under which credit is subject to must be input in applicable rules description field.

additionalAmountCovered.description: Specifies any additional amounts available under the Letter of Credit, such as insurance, freight, interest, etc.

draweeId.description: Identifies the name of the drawee of Bills of Exchange to be presented under the LC, if the drawee is a customer of the bank with a valid customer number.

partialShipment.description: Identifies if part shipments are allowed under the terms of the Letter of Credit. Valid codes are ALLOWED, CONDITIONAL, and NOT ALLOWED.

transhipment.description: Identifies if transhipments are allowed under the terms of the LC. Valid codes are ALLOWED, CONDITIONAL, and NOT ALLOWED.

placeOfTakingInCharge.description: Indicates the place of taking in charge(in case of multimodal transport document), the place of receipt(in case of a road, rail or inland waterway transport document or a courier expedited delivery service document), the place of dispatch or the place of shipment to be indicated on the transport document

portOfLoading.description: Indicates the place of dispatch or taking in charge of the goods or loading on board for shipments made under the LC.

portOfDischarge.description: Indicates the port of discharge or the airport of destination of the shipment under the LC.

finalDestination.description: Indicates the final destination or place of delivery of the shipment under the LC.

latestShipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC.

daysAndPeriodForPresentation.description: Specifies the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation.

requestedConfirmBankName.description: Name and address of the requested confirming bank, i.e. the bank which may or which is requested by the issuing bank to add its confirmation to the documentary credit.

senderToReceiverInfo.description: This field holds the additional information for the Receiver (Tag 72Z), while receiving/generating MT740 message.

advisingBanks.description: Identifies the advising bank under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

advisingBank.description: Identifies the advising bank under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

limitReferences.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

drawingType.description: This field is correlated to the other field payment type and identifies the Draw type under Letter of credit. Whether its a sight LC payment, acceptance, deferred payment or Mixed payment.

paymentPercent.description: This field identifies the percentage amount of LC that is available for a particular draw type.

paymentPortion.description: Identifies the amount of LC that is available for a particular draw type.

acptTimeBand.description: This field indicate the number of days applicable to an Acceptance or Deferred Payment period under a letter of credit.

additionalCoveredAmount.description: This field allows input of an amount that will be added to the liability amount of the LC and the limit will be updated accordingly.

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

charges.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

chargeCode.description: Indicates the charge code to which the charges are identified and calculated and to be debited to the customer account. For example: C(Credit less Charges The Credit less Charges), D(Debit plus Charge The Debit plus Charge) , W(Waive).

partyCharged.description: Code to determine the identity of the party from whom the related charge is to be taken. Allowed values: -B(eneficiary) - O(pener) - T(hird Party).

chargeDebitAccount.description: The account number of the account where charges will be debited to.

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

ChargeExchangeRate.description: Indicates the exchange rate to be used between the charge debit account and the charge currency is different.

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

amortiseCharges.description: Define if charges are to be amortised over the life of the LC. Y or N  input

chargeStatus.description: Indicates the codes to identify the different status of the charge. If the charge has been taken, claimed, or to be deferred or waived. The codes that are used to identify various states of the charge are: null, 2, 3, 4, 5, 15.

taxCurrency.description: Contains the currency that tax is to be levied in. Example USD, GBP etc.

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

assignments.description: This field provides the user with a free text field to make any internal notes regarding the assignment.

assignmentReference.description: Identifies a recognisable reference for each assignment portion. This reference cannot be duplicated within the letter of credit record and should be unique.

assigneeId.description: Identify the customer number of the assignee if they are a customer of the bank. Should be a valid customer number.

assignmentAmount.description: Identify the total amount of the letter of credit which has been assigned to the assignee under the specific assignee reference/multi value set. This amount cannot exceed the liability amount.

assigntOutstandingAmount.description: Provides user the option of changing various details of the security position to be transferred

assigneeAddress.description: Identifies the assignee's name and address if they are not a customer of the bank.

assignmentNote.description: This field provides the user with a free text field to make any internal notes regarding the assignment.

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

beneficiaryId.description: Indicates the reference of the financial institution that allows access to the beneficiary information

autoExpiry.description: Decision field to determine whether the contingent entries are to be reversed after the deal expiry date or not Allowed values: - YES - NO - null (default value, same as NO)

placeOfTakingInCharge.description: Indicates the place of taking in charge(in case of multimodal transport document), the place of receipt(in case of a road, rail or inland waterway transport document or a courier expedited delivery service document), the place of dispatch or the place of shipment to be indicated on the transport document

portOfLoading.description: Indicates the place of dispatch or taking in charge of the goods or loading on board for shipments made under the LC.

portOfDischarge.description: Indicates the port of discharge or the airport of destination of the shipment under the LC.

finalDestination.description: Indicates the final destination or place of delivery of the shipment under the LC.

reimbursingBank.description: Identifies the reimbursing bank ID under the LC, through whom reimbursement will be made to the paying/negotiating bank for a letter of credit. (Reimbursing bank should be a valid customer with customer ID)

reimbursingBankAndAddress.description: Identifies the Name & Address of the reimbursing bank under the LC. If the third party reimbursing bank is not one of the banks customers (i.e. not on the customer list), then this field allows the input of a name and address of the reimbursing bank.

applicableRuleCodesMT740.description: Indicates the reimbursement rules that the Letter of Credit contract is subject to. Allowed values: - URR LATEST VERSION - NOTURR - null (default)

chargeFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

chargeBaseAmount.description: Indicates the portion of the Letter of Credit amount for which the charges are to be applied at the time of amendment instead of recalculation the charges for the full LC value. If left blank, LC.AMOUNT will be used for calculating default charges

chargeDefaultAccount.description: This field identifies the default charge account under which all present and future charges under the letter of credit will be debited to. This eliminates the need to specify the charge account for every charge

waiveCharge.description: Indicates if the charges are to be waived for the instruction

marginRequired.description: Decision field enabling a cash margin to be blocked for the LC contract. Yes or No, default is No

marginCalculationBase.description: This field determines if the margin to be calculated based on the LC base amount or the total liability amount including tolerance etc.

marginPercent.description: Field to state the percentage of provision to be taken

marginDebitAccount.description: Field to state the account from which the provision amount is to be debited

marginAmount.description: Actual amount of provision that is debited for the transaction

marginExchangeRate.description: This Field determines the exchange rate to be used between the provision debit account and the provision credit account, when the currencies differ

limitWithProvision.description: This field determines if the margin calculated to be debited after considering the limits booked under the LC contract. Yes or No

docyCreditNumber.description: Identifies the Advising banks LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system) or it can be used for the bank to use a unique Letter of Credit number rather than the system generated ID

reimbursingBankReference.description: Identifies the reimbursing banks number, to be input at the time of generating the SWIFT MT747 (Amendment to an authorisation to reimburse.)

dateOfOriginalAuthorisation.description: This is a system populated field to display the date on which MT740 (Authorization to Reimburse) was sent.

newDocyCreditAmount.description: Denote the currency of the Letter of Credit.

senderToReceiverInfo.description: This field holds the additional information for the Receiver (Tag 72Z), while receiving/generating MT740 message.

additionalAmountsCovered.description: Specifies any additional amounts available under the Letter of Credit, such as insurance, freight, interest, etc.

additionalAmountCovered.description: Specifies any additional amounts available under the Letter of Credit, such as insurance, freight, interest, etc.

beneficiaries.description: Identifies the Beneficiary name and address of the Standing Order

beneficiary.description: Identifies the Beneficiary name and address of the Standing Order

shipmentPeriods.description: Indicates the period of time which the goods are to be loaded on board/dispatched/taken in charge.

shipmentPeriod.description: Indicates the period of time which the goods are to be loaded on board/dispatched/taken in charge.

narrativeCharges.description: Field to specify the details of the charges to be borne by the beneficiary

narrativeCharge.description: Field to specify the details of the charges to be borne by the beneficiary

charges.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

chargeCode.description: Indicates the charge code to which the charges are identified and calculated and to be debited to the customer account. For example: C(Credit less Charges The Credit less Charges), D(Debit plus Charge The Debit plus Charge) , W(Waive).

partyCharged.description: Code to determine the identity of the party from whom the related charge is to be taken. Allowed values: -B(eneficiary) - O(pener) - T(hird Party).

chargeDebitAccount.description: The account number of the account where charges will be debited to.

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

chargeExchangeRate.description: Indicates the exchange rate to be used between the charge debit account and the charge currency is different.

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

amortiseCharge.description: Define if charges are to be amortised over the life of the LC. Y or N  input

chargeStatus.description: Indicates the codes to identify the different status of the charge. If the charge has been taken, claimed, or to be deferred or waived. The codes that are used to identify various states of the charge are: null, 2, 3, 4, 5, 15.

taxCurrency.description: Contains the currency that tax is to be levied in. Example USD, GBP etc.

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

reimNarratives.description: This field holds the details of the amendments (Tag 77), while generating/receiving MT747 message type.(Amendment to an authorisation to reimburse.)

reimNarrative.description: This field holds the details of the amendments (Tag 77), while generating/receiving MT747 message type.(Amendment to an authorisation to reimburse.)

operation.description: Identifies the required operation to be executed for a Trade Finance contract. Input of valid codes as: O for opening of LC, P for Pre-advise of LC, A for Amend LC, C for Collect Charges, D for Decision on Amendments, T for Tracer, IO for LC through Internet Banking Operation and M for Ancillary Message (MT759)

sendAmendmentAdvice.description: Decides if an amendment is external or internal . Valid input is YES, indicating that an amendment is external and that a message is to be communicated to other parties of the Letter of Credit. Otherwise, NO indicates an internal amendment hence no message output.

lcNumber.description: Identifies the Advising banks LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system) or it can be used for the bank to use a unique Letter of Credit number rather than the system generated ID

advisingBankReference.description: Advising Bank reference number for use on messages and advices under the LC contract

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

amendmentDate.description: Date of the last external amendment, on which the issuing bank considers the Letter of Credit as being amended.

lcType.description: Indicates the type of LC, whether this is an Import/Export, Confirmed/Unconfirmed/Revolving/Transferrable/Back to Back LC/documentary collection/Clean collection etc.

applicant.description: Indicates the applicant name and address on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is being pre advised.

advisingBank.description: Identifies the advising bank under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

newLcCurrency.description: Denote the currency of the Letter of Credit

newLcAmount.description: This field indicates the new amount of the Letter of Credit that will always be expressed in the currency of Letter of Credit.

creditTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit the amount can be specified plus or minus a tolerance expressed as a percentage which will always impact the LC liability for the greater amount including the plus tolerance as defined in this field.

debitTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit, the amount can be specified with a tolerance, which will impact the LC liability for the greater amount. The amount in this field specifies a negative tolerance expressed as a percentage of the LC amount. It can impact the final drawing amount but not the live LC amount.

purposeOfMessage.description: Indicates the purpose of MT707 amendment message, whether its the issuance of amendment message or advise of amendment message to the second advising bank or advise and confirmation of amendment message to the second advising bank. Permitted Codes are: ACNF - Advice and confirmation of the credit amendment ADVI - Advice of the credit amendment ISSU - Issuance of the credit amendment

cancellationRequest.description: Indicates that the documentary credit is requested to be cancelled. Valid input in this field is CANCEL.

daysAndPeriodForPresentation.description: Specifies the number of calendar days after the date of shipment within which the documents must be presented for payment, acceptance or negotiation.

latestShipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC.

newLCExpiryDate.description: New Expiry date for presentation under the Letter of Credit

newLCExpiryPlace.description: New Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

liabilityReversalDate.description: Date on which the contingent entries and the limits raised on the LC will be reversed.

portOfLoading.description: Indicates the place of dispatch or taking in charge of the goods or loading on board for shipments made under the LC.

portOfDischarge.description: Indicates the port of discharge or the airport of destination of the shipment under the LC.

finalDestination.description: Indicates the final destination or place of delivery of the shipment under the LC.

shipmentPeriod.description: Indicates the period of time which the goods are to be loaded on board/dispatched/taken in charge.

latestShipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC.

chargeFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

chargeDefaultAccount.description: This field identifies the default charge account under which all present and future charges under the letter of credit will be debited to. This eliminates the need to specify the charge account for every charge

waiveCharge.description: Indicates if the charges are to be waived for the instruction

commissionCode.description: These field control the allocation of Periodic commission where the field COMM.CODE is the trigger for periodic commission and the field CSN.CODE is a system maintained field and hold the commission amount relating to the period band

waiveCommission.description: This field indicates whether any default charges under Letters of Credit are to be waived. Values are Yes, Null If yes is selected, then the subject commission will not be collected.

commissionPartyCharge.description: Indicates if the commission is claimed from opener or beneficiary Options - O(Opener) or B(Beneficiary) Allowed only when commission is claimed.

commissionStartDate.description: Indicates the Start date for calculation of the Letter of Credit commission

commissionFrequency.description: Indicates the frequency at which the commission is to be collected or claimed. Only monthly frequency allowed (M01, M02, etc.

commissionRate.description: The commission by percentage. Allowed only for manual commission. Calculated commission amount can be overwritten manually.

accrualParam.description: Indicates if the value date or maturity date or both need to be considered for commission calculation.

commissionAmount.description: Amount of commission charged for the payment created with respect to the commission type used.

fixedCommissionAmount.description: Indicates the fixed commission amount for each commission schedule. Amount expressed in the currency of the contract.

commissionAccount.description: Indicates the Account from which the commission amount is to be collected.

commissionExchangeRate.description: Indicates the Exchange rate to be applied between commission(contract) currency and commission account currency.

commissionClaimed.description: Indicates if the commission is to be collected from the customer's account or claimed. Yes To be claimed Null To be collected from customers account

backForwardKey.description: Identifies on which day the scheduled frequency date is to be cycled, when the scheduled date is not a working day. C - Calendar P - Previous working day N - Next working day.

returnCommission.description: Determines whether the excess commission amount calculated on account of principal decrease is to be returned to the customer or not. YES or No. Value gets defaulted from LC.PARAMETERS which can be amended by the user.

uptoDays.description: This is a system maintained field containing the number of days for which the commission is calculated for the associated period band.

additionalAmountsCovered.description: Specifies any additional amounts available under the Letter of Credit, such as insurance, freight, interest, etc.

additionalAmountCovered.description: Specifies any additional amounts available under the Letter of Credit, such as insurance, freight, interest, etc.

limitReferences.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

beneficiaries.description: Identifies the Beneficiary name and address of the Standing Order

beneficiary.description: Identifies the Beneficiary name and address of the Standing Order

bankToBanks.description: Field to specify the additional information for the Receiver i.e. between banks handling the Letter of Credit

bankToBank.description: Field to specify the additional information for the Receiver i.e. between banks handling the Letter of Credit

internalAmendmentDetails.description: This is a free text field for updating the internal amendment details

internalAmendmentDetail.description: This is a free text field for updating the internal amendment details

charges.description: Defines the charges collected for a transaction

chargeCode.description: Indicates the charge code to which the charges are identified and calculated and to be debited to the customer account. For example: C(Credit less Charges The Credit less Charges), D(Debit plus Charge The Debit plus Charge) , W(Waive).

partyCharged.description: Code to determine the identity of the party from whom the related charge is to be taken. Allowed values: -B(eneficiary) - O(pener) - T(hird Party).

chargeDebitAccount.description: The account number of the account where charges will be debited to.

chargeCurrency.description: Indicates the currency code of the charge account from where the fee is deducted

ChargeExchangeRate.description: Indicates the exchange rate to be used between the charge debit account and the charge currency is different.

chargeAmount.description: Retrieves the Charge Amount after redeem

amortiseCharges.description: Define if charges are to be amortised over the life of the LC. Y or N  input

chargeStatus.description: Indicates the codes to identify the different status of the charge. If the charge has been taken, claimed, or to be deferred or waived. The codes that are used to identify various states of the charge are: null, 2, 3, 4, 5, 15.

taxCurrency.description: Contains the currency that tax is to be levied in. Example USD, GBP etc.

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

commissions.description: The bank fees or commission charged for the transaction

commissionCode.description: These field control the allocation of Periodic commission where the field COMM.CODE is the trigger for periodic commission and the field CSN.CODE is a system maintained field and hold the commission amount relating to the period band

uptoAmount.description: This is a system maintained field containing the amount on which the commission rate is applied to arrive at the commission amount.

commissionRate.description: The commission by percentage. Allowed only for manual commission. Calculated commission amount can be overwritten manually.

commissionAmount.description: Amount of commission charged for the payment created with respect to the commission type used.

amendmentNumber.description: Indicates the amendment number under the Letter of Credit.

amendStatus.description: System updated field at the time of Amendment decision under the Letter of Credit using Operation 'D'. This field indicates the current status of the amendment whether amendment is pending, approved or rejected.

sendAmendmentAdvice.description: Decides if an amendment is external or internal . Valid input is YES, indicating that an amendment is external and that a message is to be communicated to other parties of the Letter of Credit. Otherwise, NO indicates an internal amendment hence no message output.

lcNumber.description: Identifies the Advising banks LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system) or it can be used for the bank to use a unique Letter of Credit number rather than the system generated ID

advisingBankReference.description: Advising Bank reference number for use on messages and advices under the LC contract

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

lcType.description: Indicates the type of LC, whether this is an Import/Export, Confirmed/Unconfirmed/Revolving/Transferrable/Back to Back LC/documentary collection/Clean collection etc.

amendmentDate.description: Date of the last external amendment, on which the issuing bank considers the Letter of Credit as being amended.

applicantCustomer.description: Indicates the applicant ID on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is issued.

advisingBank.description: Identifies the advising bank under the Letter of Credit, through whom the Letter of Credit is to be advised to the second advising bank or beneficiary

lcCurrency.description: Denote the currency of the Letter of Credit.

lcAmount.description: This field indicates the amount of the Letter of Credit that will always be expressed in the currency of Letter of Credit.

creditTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit the amount can be specified plus or minus a tolerance expressed as a percentage which will always impact the LC liability for the greater amount including the plus tolerance as defined in this field.

debitTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit, the amount can be specified with a tolerance, which will impact the LC liability for the greater amount. The amount in this field specifies a negative tolerance expressed as a percentage of the LC amount. It can impact the final drawing amount but not the live LC amount.

purposeOfMessage.description: Indicates the purpose of MT707 amendment message, whether its the issuance of amendment message or advise of amendment message to the second advising bank or advise and confirmation of amendment message to the second advising bank. Permitted Codes are: ACNF - Advice and confirmation of the credit amendment ADVI - Advice of the credit amendment ISSU - Issuance of the credit amendment

cancellationRequest.description: Indicates that the documentary credit is requested to be cancelled. Valid input in this field is CANCEL.

newLCExpiryDate.description: New Expiry date for presentation under the Letter of Credit

newLCExpiryPlace.description: New Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

liabilityReversalDate.description: Date on which the contingent entries and the limits raised on the LC will be reversed.

placeOfTakingInCharges.description: Indicates the place of taking in charge(in case of multimodal transport document), the place of receipt(in case of a road, rail or inland waterway transport document or a courier expedited delivery service document), the place of dispatch or the place of shipment to be indicated on the transport document

portsOfLoading.description: Indicates the place of dispatch or taking in charge of the goods or loading on board for shipments made under the LC.

portOfDischarge.description: Indicates the port of discharge or the airport of destination of the shipment under the LC.

finalDestination.description: Indicates the final destination or place of delivery of the shipment under the LC.

amortiseCharges.description: Define if charges are to be amortised over the life of the LC. Y or N  input

chargeStatus.description: Indicates the codes to identify the different status of the charge. If the charge has been taken, claimed, or to be deferred or waived. The codes that are used to identify various states of the charge are: null, 2, 3, 4, 5, 15.

taxCurrency.description: Contains the currency that tax is to be levied in. Example USD, GBP etc.

taxAmount.description: Total amount of taxes applicable on all commission or charges calculated for the transaction/payment.

amendmentNumber.description: Indicates the amendment number under the Letter of Credit.

lcType.description: Indicates the type of LC, whether this is an Import/Export, Confirmed/Unconfirmed/Revolving/Transferrable/Back to Back LC/documentary collection/Clean collection etc.

amendStatus.description: System updated field at the time of Amendment decision under the Letter of Credit using Operation 'D'. This field indicates the current status of the amendment whether amendment is pending, approved or rejected.

applicantCustomer.description: Indicates the applicant ID on whose behalf the Letter of Credit is issued.

lcNumber.description: Identifies the Advising banks LCs number (or reference of the L/C from legacy system) or it can be used for the bank to use a unique Letter of Credit number rather than the system generated ID

sendAmendmentAdvice.description: Decides if an amendment is external or internal . Valid input is YES, indicating that an amendment is external and that a message is to be communicated to other parties of the Letter of Credit. Otherwise, NO indicates an internal amendment hence no message output.

issuingBankReference.description: Issuing Bank/Advising Bank/Customer reference number for use on messages and advices under the LC contract. For Export LCs this is the Issuing Bank's reference. For Import LCs this is the Advising Bank's reference

issueDate.description: The date the item was issued.

issuingBankId.description: Identifies the Issuing bank ID under the LC, who issues the LC under when a bank is advising the Letter of Credit

lcCurrency.description: Denote the currency of the Letter of Credit.

lcAmount.description: This field indicates the amount of the Letter of Credit that will always be expressed in the currency of Letter of Credit.

creditTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit the amount can be specified plus or minus a tolerance expressed as a percentage which will always impact the LC liability for the greater amount including the plus tolerance as defined in this field.

debitTolerance.description: Under a Letter of Credit, the amount can be specified with a tolerance, which will impact the LC liability for the greater amount. The amount in this field specifies a negative tolerance expressed as a percentage of the LC amount. It can impact the final drawing amount but not the live LC amount.

purposeOfMessage.description: Indicates the purpose of MT707 amendment message, whether its the issuance of amendment message or advise of amendment message to the second advising bank or advise and confirmation of amendment message to the second advising bank. Permitted Codes are: ACNF - Advice and confirmation of the credit amendment ADVI - Advice of the credit amendment ISSU - Issuance of the credit amendment

cancellationRequest.description: Indicates that the documentary credit is requested to be cancelled. Valid input in this field is CANCEL.

additionalAmountCovered.description: Specifies any additional amounts available under the Letter of Credit, such as insurance, freight, interest, etc.

newLCExpiryDate.description: New Expiry date for presentation under the Letter of Credit

expiryPlace.description: Expiry place for presentation under the documentary credit.

liabilityReversalDate.description: Date on which the contingent entries and the limits raised on the LC will be reversed.

limitReference.description: Identifies the credit limit reference for the underlying account.

placeOfTakingInCharge.description: Indicates the place of taking in charge(in case of multimodal transport document), the place of receipt(in case of a road, rail or inland waterway transport document or a courier expedited delivery service document), the place of dispatch or the place of shipment to be indicated on the transport document

portOfLoading.description: Indicates the place of dispatch or taking in charge of the goods or loading on board for shipments made under the LC.

portOfDischarge.description: Indicates the port of discharge or the airport of destination of the shipment under the LC.

finalDestination.description: Indicates the final destination or place of delivery of the shipment under the LC.

latestShipmentDate.description: Latest date for loading on board/dispatch/taking in charge for goods shipped under the LC.

chargeFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

chargeDefaultAccount.description: This field identifies the default charge account under which all present and future charges under the letter of credit will be debited to. This eliminates the need to specify the charge account for every charge

draftPrint.description: This field indicate whether a draft print of the Letter of Credit / Documentary Collection document created is to be produced on deal input (i.e. before the authorization stage) Y' or 'N'. Default from LC.PARAMETERS file.

chargeFrom.description: Code to identify from whom the bank is to claim its charges. Allowed values: - O(pener) - B(eneficiary) - T(hird Party)

waiveCharge.description: Indicates if the charges are to be waived for the instruction

commissionCode.description: These field control the allocation of Periodic commission where the field COMM.CODE is the trigger for periodic commission and the field CSN.CODE is a system maintained field and hold the commission amount relating to the period band

waiveCommission.description: This field indicates whether any default charges under Letters of Credit are to be waived. Values are Yes, Null If yes is selected, then the subject commission will not be collected.

commissionStartDate.description: Indicates the Start date for calculation of the Letter of Credit commission

commissionFrequency.description: Indicates the frequency at which the commission is to be collected or claimed. Only monthly frequency allowed (M01, M02, etc.

commissionRate.description: The commission by percentage. Allowed only for manual commission. Calculated commission amount can be overwritten manually.

accrualParam.description: Indicates if the value date or maturity date or both need to be considered for commission calculation.

commissionAmount.description: Amount of commission charged for the payment created with respect to the commission type used.

fixedCommissionAmount.description: Indicates the fixed commission amount for each commission schedule. Amount expressed in the currency of the contract.

commissionAccount.description: Indicates the Account from which the commission amount is to be collected.

commissionExchangeRate.description: Indicates the Exchange rate to be applied between commission(contract) currency and commission account currency.

backForwardKey.description: Identifies on which day the scheduled frequency date is to be cycled, when the scheduled date is not a working day. C - Calendar P - Previous working day N - Next working day.

returnCommission.description: Determines whether the excess commission amount calculated on account of principal decrease is to be returned to the customer or not. YES or No. Value gets defaulted from LC.PARAMETERS which can be amended by the user.
